BacterialBlights.description: Bacterial blight causes reddish-brown streaks on leaves and can affect crop yield.
BacterialBlights.prevention: Plant disease-free cane and avoid mechanical injury.
BacterialBlights.cure: Use hot water treatment and resistant varieties.

Healthy.description: The sugarcane plant is healthy and shows no visible symptoms of disease.
Healthy.cause: Absence of pathogens or environmental stress.
Healthy.prevention: Maintain proper field hygiene and good farming practices.

Mosaic.description: Sugarcane mosaic causes mottled green and yellow patterns on leaves, stunting growth.
Mosaic.cause: Sugarcane mosaic virus (SCMV), transmitted by aphids.
Mosaic.prevention: Use virus-free planting material and control aphid vectors.
Mosaic.cure: No direct cure; remove infected plants and control aphids.

RedRot.description: Red rot is a severe fungal disease that discolors internal cane tissues and weakens the plant.
RedRot.prevention: Grow resistant varieties and avoid water stagnation.
RedRot.cure: Remove infected canes and apply recommended fungicides.

Rust.description: Rust causes orange to brown pustules on leaves, leading to leaf drying and reduced yield.
Rust.prevention: Avoid planting susceptible varieties and ensure field sanitation.
Rust.cure: Use fungicides like triadimefon and grow resistant varieties.

Yellow.description: Yellow leaf syndrome causes leaf yellowing starting from the midrib, progressing outward.
Yellow.cause: Sugarcane yellow leaf virus (ScYLV), spread by aphids.
Yellow.prevention: Control aphids and use healthy planting materials.
Yellow.cure: No known cure; remove affected plants and manage vectors.
